2.text: Truly, I know that it is so, and that man cannot be justified compared with God.

3.text: If he chooses to contend with him, he is not able to respond to him once out of a thousand times.

4.text: He is understanding in heart and mighty in strength; who has resisted him and yet had peace?

5.text: He has moved mountains, and those whom he overthrew in his fury did not know it.

6.text: He shakes the earth out of its place and its pillars tremble.

7.text: He commands the sun and it does not rise, and he closes the stars as if under a seal.

8.text: He alone extends the heavens, and he walks upon the waves of the sea.

9.text: He fashions Arcturus, and Orion, and Hyades, and the interior of the south.

10.text: He accomplishes great and incomprehensible and miraculous things, which cannot be numbered.

11.text: If he approaches me, I will not see him; if he departs, I will not understand.

12.text: If he suddenly should question, who will answer him? Or who can say, “Why did you do so?”

13.text: God, whose wrath no one is able to resist, and under whom they bend who carry the world,

14.text: what am I then, that I should answer him and exchange words with him?

15.text: And if I now have any justice, I will not respond, but will beseech my judge.

16.text: And if he should listen to me when I call, I would not believe that he had heard my voice.

17.text: For he will crush me in a whirlwind and multiply my wounds, even without cause.

18.text: He does not permit my spirit to rest, and he fills me with bitterness.

19.text: If strength is sought, he is most strong; if equity in judgment, no one would dare to give testimony for me.

20.text: If I wanted to justify myself, my own mouth will condemn me; if I would reveal my innocence, he would prove me depraved.

21.text: And if I now became simple, my soul would be ignorant even of this, and my life would weary me.

22.text: There is one thing that I have said: both the innocent and the impious he consumes.

23.text: If he scourges, let him kill all at once, and not laugh at the punishment of the innocent.

24.text: Since the earth has been given into the hand of the impious, he covers the face of its judges; for if it is not him, then who is it?

25.text: My days have been swifter than a messenger; they have fled and have not seen goodness.

26.text: They have passed by like ships carrying fruits, just like an eagle flying to food.

27.text: If I say: “By no means will I speak this way.” I change my face and I am tortured with sorrow.

28.text: I have dreaded all my works, knowing that you did not spare the offender.

29.text: Yet, if I am also just as impious, why have I labored in vain?

30.text: If I had been washed with snow-like waters, and my hands were shining like the cleanest thing,

31.text: yet you would plunge me in filth, and my own garments would abhor me.

32.text: For even I would not answer a man who were like myself, nor one who could be heard with me equally in judgment.

33.text: There is no one who could both prevail in argument and in placing his hand between the two.

34.text: Let him take his staff away from me, and let not the fear of him terrify me.

35.text: I will speak and I will not fear him, for in fearfulness I am not able to respond.
